intro: Tanacetum elongatum, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a strong, camphor-like scent. Its yellow flower heads consist of both ray and disc florets, blooming from late summer to early autumn. Tanacetum elongatum is often found in damp meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
